author: Staff Reporter
text:
At the 'valaikaappu'function at a marriage hall in Nagercoil on Friday.

It was a memorable day for 160 pregnant women from poor families in the town, as ‘baby shower’ (valaikaapu) was performed for them in a grand manner in the presence of their family members and relatives at a marriage hall here on Friday.

Organised by the Integrated Child Development Scheme (ICDS), the function was part of a scheme to cover 2,000 pregnant women who have registered with the anganwadis in the nine panchayat unions of Kanyakumari district.

The women received gifts and were told that could avail periodical medical check-ups and diet counsel. Government schemes for the newborn and the mother were explained to the women.

A medical camp by Family Health department and an exhibition by Social Welfare department were organised at the venue. Collector Sajjansingh R. Chavan inaugurated the programme.
title: ‘Valaikappu’ performed en masse for 160 women
